{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with fever, right upper quadrant pain, myalgia, jaundice, and tender hepatomegaly after returning from Southeast Asia. The presence of anti-hepatitis A IgM antibodies suggests acute hepatitis A infection. In acute hepatitis A, the liver biopsy would most likely show hepatocytes with shrunken, eosinophilic cytoplasm and pyknotic nuclei, which are characteristic of hepatocellular necrosis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
